data.title: Soitec Q3 FY'25 Revenue At EUR 226 Mln, Down 10% YoY
data.description:
Soitec SA :

  • REPORTS Q3 FY'25 REVENUE OF €226 MILLION, DOWN 10% YOY

  • FY'25 GUIDANCE REVISED: REVENUE EXPECTED TO DECREASE BY HIGH SINGLE DIGIT YEAR-ON-YEAR AT CONSTANT EXCHANGE RATES AND PERIMETER (COMPARED TO FLAT PREVIOUSLY), AND EBITDA1 MARGIN2 EXPECTED BETWEEN 32% AND 34% (COMPARED TO AROUND 35% PREVIOUSLY)

  • EXPECTS LIMITED GROWTH FOR FY'26 DUE TO MARKET CONDITIONS

  • EXPECTS FY'25 EBITDA MARGIN BETWEEN 32% AND 34%

data.title: City BBQ and Bikky get granular to fuel broad growth
data.description:
NEW YORK, Feb. 05, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) — Bikky, a customer data platform built exclusively for multi-unit restaurants, announced a partnership with City BBQ, an award-winning fast-casual brand that’s smoking and serving up tastes of the nation.

Founded in 1999 in Columbus OH, City BBQ has found steady success showcasing the breadth and depth of BBQ found across the country. The brand has been recognized by everyone from the Kansas City BBQ Association to Men’s Journal for their outstanding cuisine, most recently winning Nation’s Restaurant News Barbeque Showdown.

With ambitious plans to expand nationwide—something few BBQ chains have done before—City BBQ wanted rich guest insights to guide their growth and ensure a best-in-class experience. Having worked with a restaurant CDP in a previous role, City BBQ’s Chief Brand Officer, Annica Conrad, directed the team to Bikky.

“I knew Bikky would be instrumental in helping us achieve our goals,” said Conrad. “Their robust data brings a whole new level of sophistication to our marketing, menu, and operations.”

With this partnership, City BBQ can track and analyze the long-term behavior of their guests, empowering the brand to measure promotions, campaigns, and menu changes with precision. The team recently used Bikky to gauge the impact of a month-long acquisition campaign in honor of their 25th anniversary. They offered every member in their loyalty program, and anyone who joined within the month, a 25 cent pulled pork sandwich.

While redemption was extremely high, the brand wondered if new members were simply one-time value seekers or if they would return. Data from Bikky revealed a significantly higher return rate among new members compared to general visitors. “Before Bikky the promotion would have been a one and done because we had no way to understand the long-term impact or if it was worth repeating,” said Conrad. “With Bikky, we know for certain that it was an effective acquisition offer and we’ll likely run it again in the future.”

City BBQ also finds tremendous value in Bikky’s segmentation capabilities, which allow for highly targeted communication and engagement. The team is now segmenting guests by location to benchmark return rates and menu preferences at each of their restaurants, and have experimented with personalized ads featuring guests’ most frequent orders. “We tested serving guests ads that feature their favorite products, and we’ve seen much better return rates on those particular ads.”

Outside of marketing, Bikky is helping the brand optimize their menu and operations based on guest preferences. City BBQ had always known that their macaroni and cheese was a top-selling product, but Bikky’s insights showed that it’s the most popular item among new guests. “We didn’t realize how many new guests ate mac and cheese,” said Conrad. “Now we’re working hard to optimize that product because if it’s the first thing a new guest eats, it has to be the best it can be.” The team is keeping a close eye on which menu items rise to the top and which drive repeat visits so they're always on top of guests’ needs.

Like many brands, City BBQ’s primary focus for 2025 is increasing traffic. They’re certain Bikky’s guest insights give them a serious advantage as they scale. “With Bikky we’re continually refining our loyalty program so it continues to grow traffic,” said Conrad. “We believe that understanding the behavior of new guests and increasing personalization through segmentation is the best way to deliver on our goals.”

“We’re excited to support City BBQ as they scale to become the premier BBQ-focused fast casual brand in the nation,” says Abhinav Kapur, co-founder and CEO of Bikky. “They’re a clear leader in their category, and now at the forefront of how restaurant brands use customer data to grow traffic, frequency, and sales.”

The fastest-growing, most innovative restaurants in today’s competitive market look to Bikky for insight into how their decisions impact key metrics like frequency and traffic. City BBQ joins a growing roster of brands, including Robeks, WaBa Grill, and Dave’s Hot Chicken, which rely on Bikky’s groundbreaking guest data and analytics platform.

About City BBQ

City Barbeque has been proudly serving the flavor of America since opening its first joint in 1999 and has consistently been recognized as a top BBQ spot, most recently winning the Nation’s Restaurant News BBQ Showdown. The company is also celebrated as an outstanding employer and community partner, hosting thousands of fundraisers for local charities and nonprofits. Today, teams at more than 70 locations smoke meats on site over local hickory wood and prepare homemade sides and desserts fresh every day. The growing fast-casual brand operates in ten states and counting, serving the city's best barbeque for dine-in, carryout, delivery, and catering.

For more information, visit City Barbeque at www.citybbq.com

About Bikky

Bikky is a customer data platform exclusively for multi-unit restaurant brands.

With Bikky, brands like Dave's Hot Chicken, Bojangles, and Robeks clearly understand how their marketing, menu, and operations impact guest traffic and frequency. By connecting with your entire tech stack—from POS to loyalty—Bikky delivers insight on up to 90% of your guest base, empowering you to make informed, fast decisions that drive incremental sales.

Bikky is based in New York City and has raised nearly $15 million in funding to date.

Contact:

Abhinav Kapur, Founder & CEO, Bikky

Abhinav@bikky.com

data.title: Volcon Prices $12 Million Unit Offering; Shares Fall
data.description:
Volcon said Wednesday it priced a public offering of 6 million common units at $2 apiece for expected gross proceeds of about $12 million.

Each unit consists of one common share or pre-funded warrant and one registered common warrant to purchase one share, the company said.

The company said it expects the offering to close on or about Feb. 6 and plans to use the net proceeds for general corporate purposes and working capital.

Volcon shares were down more than 44% in recent trading.

data.title: CAC 40 Edges Lower on Wednesday
data.description:
The CAC 40 fell 0.2% to close at 7,892 on Wednesday, with persistent trade tensions continuing to weigh, while investors focused on the latest corporate earnings reports and economic data.

The heavyweight luxury sector extended its downturn, with LVMH, L'Oréal, and Kering, losing between 1% and 1.5%, amid ongoing concerns that the US-China trade war could hinder economic growth in the world’s largest economies.

However, positive earnings results helped offset some of the losses.

TotalEnergies saw a 1.7% increase after posting a $3.96 billion net profit for Q4, marking a 72% rise from the previous quarter.

Crédit Agricole rose 0.8% after reporting a 27% increase in quarterly profits, while Publicis gained 2% following a 6.3% organic net revenue growth in Q4, surpassing both expectations and its own guidance.

On the economic front, industrial production in December 2024 fell 0.4% month-on-month, worse than the expected 0.1% decline, reversing a revised 0.1% increase in November.

data.title: Mattel Stock Trades Above 52-Week High — WSJ
data.description:
By Owen Tucker-Smith

Mattel shares surged 16% Wednesday and are trading above their highest level over the past year.

The company reported earnings ahead of consensus estimates late Tuesday. Citi analysts noted that the beat primarily came from the company's margins, with sales slightly ahead of Wall Street's expectations.

  • Dolls revenue sank, which the analysts attributed to "the lapping of Barbie movie-related benefits last year." A jump in Hot Wheels sales, meanwhile, pushed up the company's vehicles revenue.
  • The company is preparing for potential tariffs by depending on global suppliers and possibly raising prices, Chief Executive Ynon Kreiz said. It issued 2025 guidance ahead of Wall Street consensus.
  • Mattel shares are up 18% this year, and 14% over the past six months.

"Mattel was able to dispel concerns about comping the success of the Barbie movie in impressive fashion, nicely growing full year earnings versus a year ago," the Citi analysts wrote.

Read more on the toy maker's results:

This item is part of a Wall Street Journal live coverage event. The full stream can be found by searching P/WSJL (WSJ Live Coverage).

data.title: Market Reaction on PayPal Was 'Overblown,' Company in Better Hands — Market Talk
data.description: The market's stock reaction to PayPal earnings was overblown, especially considering underlying numbers such as transaction margin dollar growth, Bernstein analysts say in a research note. The digital-payments company also continued growing incrementality of many initiatives such as modern experiences, debit cards and Venmo. "These initiatives, along with consumer habituation drivers such as debit cards, can support Branded volume growth in 2025," the analysts say. Overall, PayPal appears to be under more solid footing under the new management team, the analysts add, noting that they expect slightly more favorable risk-reward in the near-term. Shares rise 2.2% following a 13% drop on Tuesday. (sabela.ojea@wsj.com; @sabelaojeaguix)

data.title: Connecticut Housing Finance Authority to Issue $121 Million of Sustainability Bonds
data.description:
By Zaeem Shoaib

The Connecticut Housing Finance Authority is issuing nearly $121 million of sustainability bonds to finance housing programs.

The Housing Mortgage Finance Program Bonds, 2025 Series B, consist of $33.6 million in Subseries B-1 and $13.6 million in Subseries B-2 bonds that are tax-exempt, according to documents posted Tuesday on MuniOS. The securities also include $42.1 million in Subseries B-3 and $31.8 million in Subseries B-4 bonds that are federally taxable. Interest on the bonds is payable on each May 15 and Nov. 15. The bonds mature between 2025 and 2060.

Pricing is preliminarily scheduled for Feb. 10 and delivery on Feb. 25.

Proceeds will be used to finance new multifamily mortgage loans and cover certain issuance costs.

The bond are secured by revenue earned by the authority from the operations of its Housing Mortgage Finance Program.

Moody's has rated the debt Aaa and S&P assigned the bonds a rating of AAA. The Subseries B-2 bonds also have a short term rating of A-1+ from S&P.

Morgan Stanley is lead manager for the issuance.

Write to Zaeem Shoaib at zaeem.shoaib@wsj.com

data.title: Arabica coffee hits fresh record near $4/lb, sugar scales 1-mnth peak
data.description:
Arabica coffee hit a fresh record high for a tenth consecutive session on Wednesday, zeroing in on the psychologically significant $4 per lb level, while raw sugar hit a one-month peak.

COFFEE

* Arabica coffee futures on the ICE exchange , seen as a global price benchmark, rose 4% to $3.9870 per lb at 1529 GMT, after setting a record peak of $3.9905.

* Arabica has been supported by an expected output slump in top producer Brazil in the upcoming season, but analysts also say the market has a logic of its own by this point, with buying by speculators prompting other speculators to buy.

* Speculators fear getting caught on the wrong side of the rally as they did last year in cocoa, and also worry that with coffee demand being largely inelastic, the market is on course to record a deficit this season.

* There are also concerns amongst market participants more broadly that U.S. President Donald Trump might place trade tariffs on South American countries that are key coffee producers.

* Robusta coffee 2> rose 2.1% to $5,662 a ton after peaking last week at $5,840, the highest price since the contract started trading in 2008.

SUGAR

* Raw sugar futures on the ICE exchange dipped 0.1% at 19.65 cents per lb at 1536 GMT, having earlier hit their highest since Jan. 6 at 19.78 cents.

* Dealers said exporters in top producer Brazil are in no rush to sell as the Brazilian real (BRL) is strengthening, reducing their returns in local currency terms.

* They added speculators are rushing to reverse their bets on price falls, and that below-average rains in top producer Brazil in January plus dry weather in Thailand, India, China and Mexico are adding fuel to the fire.

* Looking ahead however, the global sugar balance is expected to shift to a small surplus in the 2025/26 season with production set to rise, analyst Green Pool said in its initial forecast for the crop year.

* White sugar slipped 0.1% to $526.10 a metric ton, having earlier hit a 1-1/2 month high of $531.20.

COCOA

* New York cocoa futures fell 3.3% to $10,512 a ton.

* Cadbury parent Mondelez forecast a bigger-than-estimated drop in its annual profit on Tuesday, signalling pressures from higher costs, including from surging cocoa prices.

* The company's fourth-quarter sales volumes fell in Europe, indicating high prices are starting to eat into cocoa demand.

* London cocoa fell 3.9% to 8,246 pounds per ton.

data.title: GSK's Buyback, Upgraded Guidance Boost FTSE 100
data.description:
The UK's FTSE 100 ended Wednesday's trading session 0.54% higher, led by GSK after the pharmaceutical giant raised its long-term growth outlook and announced a new share repurchase program.

GSK now expects sales of more than 40 billion pounds sterling by 2031, up from the previous guidance of over 38 billion pounds, after reporting a higher turnover in 2024. In addition, the drugmaker plans to carry out a 2 billion-pound share buyback program over the next 18 months, sending its shares up 7.46% at close.

"GSK reported FY24 results this morning which on the whole look relatively clean to us," Barclays said. "Shares are reacting strongly positive this morning ... as we believed positioning to be negative given concerns around the vaccines business (which we expect to be a major point on the call today in addition to capital allocation given we don't think a buyback was expected)."

On the other hand, TotalEnergies tumbled 1.28% after posting lower net income and sales for 2024. Still, the energy company's board recommended a final dividend of 0.85 euro per share, leading to a 7% year-over-year increase in the 2024 dividend to 3.22 euros per share.

In economic news, S&P Global data showed that UK private sector growth continued at the start of 2025. The final composite PMI stood at 50.6 in January, up from 50.4 a month ago but down from the flash reading of 50.9. The services PMI, meanwhile, clocked in at 50.8, against the prior month's 51.1 and the initial estimate of 51.2.

"January data highlighted a challenging business environment for UK service providers as stagflation conditions appeared to take a firmer hold at the start of the year," according to S&P Global Market Intelligence Economics Director Tim Moore. "A renewed downturn in new business volumes added to signs that the near-term UK economic outlook remains tilted to the downside."

The Bank of England is scheduled to publish its latest monetary policy decision on Thursday. Analysts currently expect the central bank to cut its rate to 4.5% from 4.75%.

data.title: Arion Bank hf.: Covered Bond Offering Results
data.description:
Today Arion Bank has concluded a sale of covered bonds in the series ARION CBI 28 for a total of ISK 4,060 m.

In the series ARION CBI 28 a total of 29 bids for ISK 5,700 m were received at a yield in the range of 4.09 – 4.15%. Bids in the amount of ISK 4,060 m were accepted at a 4.12% yield. The total size of the series following the issuance will be ISK 22,000 m.

The bonds are scheduled to be admitted to trading on Nasdaq Iceland on February 12th 2025.

The bonds will be issued under Arion Bank‘s covered bond programme. The Base Prospectus is available here.

The offering is managed by Arion Bank Capital Markets.

data.title: S&P 500 erases loses, turns positive despite a big decline at Alphabet
data.description:
Alphabet shares were a big drag on stocks earlier today and the Nasdaq remains 0.2% lower but the S&P 500 is now slightly higher ont he day after erasing a 30-point loss. That's impressive performance given that share of GOOG remain down 7.6%.

The market is continuing to digest this round of the trade war and the implication that Trump won't be particularly aggressive, at least against allies.

SPX day

Also helping the stock market is the ongoing drop in yields, with 10-year yields down 9 bps to 4.42% with some additional declines coming following the soft ISM services report.

data.title: Alphabet Needs to Ship New Products to Prove Incremental Engagement, Morgan Stanley Says
data.description:
Alphabet needs to ship more generative AI/GPU-enabled products to larger groups of users to show it can drive incremental engagement and more durable long-term monetization, Morgan Stanley said in a note to clients Wednesday.

"Shipping products and proving that they will indeed provide incremental multi-year revenue and cash flow growth remains the proof point that [Alphabet] needs to show in order to break out of this 16-20X PE multiple on our ~$10.40 of 2026 EPS," the investment firm said.

Morgan Stanley said it cut the company's 2026 EPS estimate by nearly 4% to $10.36 after its earnings report due to a 1% decrease in revenue and an about 11% increase in D&A.

The investment firm cut Alphabet's price target to $210 from $215, and kept its overweight rating.

Shares of Alphabet were down more than 8% in recent trading.

data.title: ADNH Catering Flags Trading Halt in Abu Dhabi
data.description:
ADNH Catering (ADX:ADNHC) shares will temporarily pause trading on the Abu Dhabi Securities Exchange from Feb. 11 at 9 am local time due to a board meeting an hour later.

The Abu Dhabi-listed food services and catering company will resume trading after it publishes the results of its meeting, according to a Wednesday release.

data.title: Canadian General Investments: Investment Update - Unaudited
data.description:
TORONTO, Canada, Feb. 05, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) — Canadian General Investments, Limited (CGI)  reports on an unaudited basis that its net asset value per share (NAV) at January 31, 2025 was $70.79 resulting in year-to-date and 12-month NAV returns, with dividends reinvested, of 2.1% and 26.3%, respectively. These compare with the 3.5% and 25.2% returns of the benchmark S&P/TSX Composite Index on a total return basis for the same periods.

The Company employs a leveraging strategy, by way of bank borrowing, with the intent to enhance returns to common shareholders. As at January 31, 2025, the leverage represented 13.5% of CGI’s net assets, down from 13.8% at the end of 2024 and 14.7% at January 31, 2024.

The closing price for CGI’s common shares at January 31, 2025 was $39.75, resulting in year-to-date and 12-month share price returns, with dividends reinvested, of -1.8% and 14.0%, respectively.

The sector weightings of CGI’s investment portfolio at market as of January 31, 2025 were as follows:

Information Technology23.7%
Industrials22.7%
Financials13.9%
Energy11.7%
Materials11.4%
Consumer Discretionary9.9%
Real Estate4.2%
Cash & Cash Equivalents1.9%
Communication Services0.6%

The top ten investments which comprised 37.0% of the investment portfolio at market as of January 31, 2025 were as follows:

The Descartes Systems Group Inc.4.0%
TFI International Inc.4.0%
Canadian Pacific Kansas City Limited4.0%
NVIDIA Corporation3.9%
Celestica Inc.3.7%
Apple Inc.3.5%
Shopify Inc.3.5%
WSP Global Inc.3.5%
Mastercard Incorporated3.5%
Franco-Nevada Corporation3.4%

FOR FURTHER INFORMATION PLEASE CONTACT:

Jonathan A. Morgan

President & CEO

Phone: (416) 366-2931

data.title: Finning Intl Looks to Improve Cost-Structure to Mitigate Tariffs — Market Talk
data.description: Finning International's answers to the threat of U.S. tariffs will be to reduce its cost profile. In an earnings call, executives said that its response to the near-term market environment of slower growth and higher uncertainty, "we are focused on managing working capital levels and evaluating opportunities to create further sustainable cost efficiency." In particular, the focus will be to improve the cost-structure in Canada. And the company already has good model to follow: "leveraging the structural changes and overhead reduction strategy demonstrated in our U.K. operations." (adriano.marchese@wsj.com)

data.title: BigBear.ai soars after US defense contract win
data.description:
** Shares of BigBear.ai up 38.8% on Weds at $6.82, highest since May 2022, after announcing Department of Defense (DoD) contract win

** BBAI on course for biggest one-day pct gain in two years

** Columbia, Maryland-based firm early Weds said it was awarded contract by the DoD Chief Digital and Artificial Intelligence Office (CDAO) to advance its Virtual Anticipation Network (VANE) prototype for geopolitical risk analysis

** The prototype award designed to improve CDAO’s ability to better assess news media originating in countries that are potential foreign adversaries, co said

** About 110 mln shares have traded on the session compared to the 10-DMA volume of roughly 34 mln shares, per LSEG

** With move on Weds, shares up ~54% YTD. Stock closed at $1.58 a year ago

** Co has ~251.6 mln shares outstanding for approx $1.7 bln market cap - LSEG
